subject: Self Care
title: Body Scan for Emotional Awareness
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Body Scan for Emotional Awareness.

hook.text: She didn't know she was anxious until she noticed her jaw was clenched. The body knew before the mind did.

buildup.text: A body scan moves attention slowly from head to toe, noticing sensations without trying to change them.

discovery.text: Stored emotions often live in the body: tight shoulders from responsibility, stomach knots from anxiety, chest aches from grief.

twist.text: Simply noticing tension often releases it. Awareness without judgment is itself a form of healing and compassion.

climax.text: Try a three-minute body scan: head, chest, stomach, hands, feet. Where is the tension? Breathe into it gently.

punchline.text: Scan your body daily. Tension speaks what words don't.

quiz.question: Why does simply noticing body tension often release it?
